This is a list of [[James Bond]] [[List of James Bond allies|allies]] in the film ''[[Die Another Day]]''.
==Recurring allies== *[[M (James Bond)|M]] - [[Judi Dench]] *[[Q (James Bond)|Q]] - [[John Cleese]] *[[Miss Moneypenny]] - [[Samantha Bond]] *[[Charles Robinson (James Bond)|Charles Robinson]] - [[Colin Salmon]]
==Jinx== {{James Bond Character |image= |bgcolor=#039 |fgcolor=#fff |name=Giacinta "Jinx" Johnson |portrayed=[[Halle Berry]] |gender=[[Female]] |affiliation=[[National Security Agency]] |status=Active |role=[[Bond girl]] }}
'''Giacinta "Jinx" Johnson''' is an [[National Security Agency|NSA]] agent who joins with Bond to spy on Zao and look into his ties with Gustav Graves. She is portrayed by [[United States|American]] [[actress]] [[Halle Berry]].
In discussing her character, Berry said Jinx is "fashion-forward modern and the next step in the evolution of women in the Bond movies."<ref>{{cite news |title=Halle's big year| work=Ebony, | date=Nov, 2002 | quote=Of her character, Berry said: She's the next step in the evolution of women in the Bond movies. She's more modern and not the classic villain. She also said that Jinx is fashionable. She's fashion-forward, very sexy and takes fashion risks, and I love her for that.}}</ref>
The scene where she emerges from the ocean in a bikini paid homage to the character of [[Honey Ryder]] ([[Ursula Andress]]) from the first Bond film, ''[[Dr. No (film)|Dr. No]]''. Despite the bikini and location of [[Cuba]] in the film, the footage of the water and bar scene was shot in [[Cadiz]] and far from the warmth implied in the film; The location was reportedly very cold and windy, and footage has been released of Berry wrapped in thick towels in between takes to avoid catching a chill.<ref>''Die Another Day'' Special Edition DVD 2002, Retrieved on March 28, 2008</ref>
According to an [[ITV]] news poll, Jinx has been voted the fourth toughest girl on screen of all time. [[Uma Thurman]], the star of [[Quentin Tarantino]]`s samurai film ''[[Kill Bill]]'' was named as the winner.<ref>[http://www.mi6.co.uk/news/index.php?itemid=1276&catid=1 www.mi6.co.uk], Retrieved on March 28, 2008</ref>
Speculation arose in 2003 of a spin-off film concentrating on the character which was scheduled for a [[November 2004|November]]/December 2004 release. It was originally reported that [[MGM]] was keen to set up a franchise and to be a "[[winter olympics]]" alternative to 'James Bond,'. As early as the late 1990s, MGM had originally considered developing a spin-off film based on [[Michelle Yeoh]]'s character, [[Wai Lin]], in 1997's ''[[Tomorrow Never Dies]]''. However, despite much speculation of an imminent movie, on October 26, 2003 , ''[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]]'' reported that MGM had completely pulled the plug on this project, to the dismay of [[Barbara Broccoli]] and [[Michael G. Wilson|Michael Wilson]] of [[Eon Entertainment]], who were reported to be "clearly furious" about the decision <ref>[http://movies.yahoo.com/shop?d=hp&cf=prev&id=1808475849 Movies.yahoo.com], Retrieved on March 28, 2008</ref>. MGM were keen to move on with the next film instead. Jinx was also the first [[Black people|black]] [[Bond Girl]], hero or villain, in more than 17 years, since [[List of James Bond henchmen in A View to a Kill#May Day|May Day]] ([[Grace Jones]]) in ''[[A View to a Kill]]'', and the first black Bond Girl ever to play the heroine (principal Bond "good girl").
<br clear=all>
== Mr. Chang == {{James Bond Character |image= |bgcolor=#039 |fgcolor=#fff |name= Mr. Chang |portrayed=[[Ho Yi]] |gender=[[Male]] |affiliation=[[Ministry of State Security of the People's Republic of China|Chinese People's External Security Force]] |status=Active |role=[[Bond ally]] }} '''Mr Chang''' is a fictional character from the [[James Bond]] film ''[[Die Another Day]]''. He is portrayed by [[Ho Yi]].
=== Film biography === An agent of the [[Ministry of State Security of the People's Republic of China|Chinese People's External Security Force]] stationed at a hotel. Chang receives Bond in a sorry state after he escaped from a hospital ship, and allows him to stay. He sends an agent posing as a masseuse to spy on Bond, suspicious of his intentions. Bond foils the scheme, revealing that he has known for years that Chang is a secret agent. After things are cleared up, he supplies Bond with aeroplane tickets to Cuba, where Zao is located. <br clear=all>
== Peaceful Fountains of Desire == {{James Bond Character |image= |bgcolor=#039 |fgcolor=#fff |name= Peaceful Fountains |portrayed=[[Rachel Grant]] |gender=[[Female]] |affiliation=[[Ministry of State Security of the People's Republic of China|Chinese People's External Security Force]] |status=Active |role=[[Bond Girl]]/[[Chinese Government Agent]] }}
'''Peaceful Fountains of Desire''' is a fictional character from the [[James Bond]] film ''[[Die Another Day]]''. She is a secondary Bond Girl who is portrayed by [[Rachel Grant]].
=== Film biography === Peaceful is a Chinese intelligence agent working for Mr Chang undercover as a masseuse at the hotel Bond is staying at. She introduces herself to Bond as coming with "compliments from the manager." Peaceful's actual intention is to find out as much as she can about Bond's mission and report back to Mr Chang. She orders Bond onto the bed, but he refuses, instead caressing her from behind. Peaceful explains that she is "not ''that'' kind of masseuse," to which Bond replies he is "not that kind of customer," removing her concealed gun from a strap on her leg and throwing an ashtray into the glass of one of the cupboards to reveal Mr Chang and two of his men filming (a reference to [[From Russia with Love (film)|From Russia with Love]]). Mr Chang reveals his motivations, concern that Britain is trying to overstep its boundaries in Hong Kong, saying "Hong Kong's [[Transfer of sovereignty of Hong Kong|our turf]] now, Bond," and the two discuss a deal with about locating Zao. Bond tells Peaceful and Mr Chang to leave unless Peaceful wishes to stay, and Chang quickly dismisses her.
<br clear=all>
==Raoul== {{James Bond Character| |image= |bgcolor=#039 |fgcolor=#fff |name=Raoul |portrayed=[[Emilio Echevarria]] |gender=Male |affiliation= |status=Active/Unknown |role=[[List of James Bond allies|Ally]] }}
'''Raoul''' is a fictional character from the [[James Bond]] film ''[[Die Another Day]]''. He is portrayed by [[Emilio Echevarria]].
===Film biography=== The manager of a Havana cigar factory, and a British [[sleeper (espionage)|sleeper]]. Raoul helps Bond track down Zao in [[Cuba]]. In the audio commentary producer [[Michael G. Wilson]] said that Raoul is based somewhat on From Russia With Love's [[List of James Bond allies in From Russia With Love#Ali Kerim Bey|Kerim Bey]].
EchevarrÃ­a, a Mexican character actor who played Raoul, filmed with the first unit in [[Cadiz]], Spain (which doubles for the Cuban capital [[Havana]]), and he took part in a month of filming in Pinewood studios <ref>[http://www.mi6.co.uk/sections/dad/raoul.php3?t=dad&s=dad www.mi6.co.uk] Retrieved on March 28, 2008</ref>
<br clear=all>
==Damian Falco== {{James Bond Character| |image= |bgcolor=#039 |fgcolor=#fff |name=Damian Falco |portrayed=[[Michael Madsen]] |gender=[[Male]] |age=Unknown |affiliation=[[NSA]] |status=Active |role=[[List of James Bond allies|Ally]] }} ''' Damian Falco''' is a [[fictional character]] from the [[James Bond]] film ''[[Die Another Day]]''. He is portrayed by [[Michael Madsen]].
===Film biography=== Damian Falco is a high-ranking official in the [[National Security Agency]] and is the boss of [[#Jinx|Giacinta "Jinx" Johnson]]. He doesnât approve of [[MI6]]. Falco is first seen when Bond is being traded for [[Zao (James Bond)|Zao]] in [[North Korea]], which he says. "Look at him, youâd think he was some kind of a hero."
He is next seen talking to [[M (James Bond)|M]] about Bond blowing up a clinic in [[Cuba]]. Finally he is seen in a US Command Bunker, in South Korea, with M, [[Charles Robinson (James Bond)|Charles Robinson]], Jinx, Bond and others. They brief Bond and Jinx, explaining what [[Gustav Graves]] is planning to do.
In a 2002 interview Madsen discussed his portrayal of Falco, remarking "It's not a big role but it's somewhat pivotal in that it introduces a new recurring character,. Most of my scenes are with Judi Dench (as M), who is a delightful human being." <ref>[http://www.webwombat.com.au/entertainment/movies/bond20_int.htm www.webcombat.com], Retrieved on March 28, 2008</ref>
Following the production of ''Die Another Day'', Madsen was confident the character would make a return saying "I will be back for Bond 21!" <ref>[http://www.mi6.co.uk/sections/dad/falco.php3?t=dad&s=dad www.mi6.co.uk], Retrieved on March 28, 2008</ref>. Despite this and with the change in the reinvention of the Bond film franchise which also saw [[Pierce Brosnan]] replaced, the character did not make an appearance in the following film, ''Casino Royale''.
<br clear=all>
==Verity== {{James Bond Character| |image= |bgcolor=#039 |fgcolor=#fff |name=Verity |portrayed=[[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]] |gender=[[Female]] |age=Unknown |affiliation= |status=Active/Unknown |role=[[Bond girl]]/[[List of James Bond allies|Ally]] }} '''Verity''' is a [[fictional character]] from the [[James Bond]] film ''[[Die Another Day]]''. She was portrayed by [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]].
After [[James Bond (character)|James Bond]] following [[Gustav Graves]] to Blades, a [[fencing]] club in [[London]], Bond meets Verity who is waiting to give him his fencing lesson. She introduces Bond to [[Miranda Frost]] and Graves.
Madonna's involvement in ''Die Another Day'' was well publicised, and was the topic of many column inches in celebrity magazines and the tabloids in 2002 both for her cameo appearance and her soundtrack performance.<ref>[http://www.mi6.co.uk/sections/articles/bond_20_madonna_ost.php3?s=articles&t= www.mi6.co.uk], Retrieved on March 28, 2008</ref> <br clear=all>
==General Moon== {{James Bond Character| |image= |name=General Moon |gender=Male |occupation=[[Colonel General|Lieutenant General]] ([[Sangjang]]) |affiliation=[[Korean People's Army]] |status=Deceased |relatives= '''Son:''' [[Gustav Graves|Tan-Sun Moon]] |role=[[List of James Bond allies|Neutral/Ally]] |portrayed=[[Kenneth Tsang]] }}
'''[[Sangjang|General]] Moon''' is a fictional character in the [[James Bond]] film ''[[Die Another Day]]'', played by [[Kenneth Tsang]]. Father to Colonel Moon, General Moon is a wise moderate man who assists in Bond's release back to the West. The [[North Korea]]n general wishes for a peaceful [[reunification of Korea]], whereas his son is bent on war.
When Bond seemingly [[assassination|assassinates]] Colonel Moon, the general, for his role as also a caring and devoted father, has him imprisoned and [[torture]]d for months to desperately find out who made his son turn [[traitor]]. He eventually releases him in exchange for the release of Zao, who had been captured by the West for [[terrorism]].
Towards the end of the movie, he is to be accompanied by [[Gustav Graves]] as he demonstrated the power of the new Icarus heat-ray in [[Iceland]]. On Graves' giant plane, while he and his officers are having a conversation with Graves, Graves tries to convince the him that the General himself is his father by saying the General's personal memorized tactics. Now the General learns that Graves is actually the new identity of his still living son, Colonel Moon, hiding behind a new face thanks to [[gene therapy]]. Graves hoped his demonstration of power to break the [[Korean Demilitarized Zone]] in order to invade [[South Korea]] would impress his father, but instead Moon realizes that his son is insane and Bond was right about him all along and threatens to kill him with one of the officers' [[Makarov PM|Makarov]], saying that the plan will instead destroy themselves and his real son died long ago. Graves disarms his father and, stating his disappointment in him, shoots him in the chest, killing him as other officers seeing their comrade getting murdered by his own son. Graves then coldly removed his Medal of Honor, provoking Bond, who's enraged at seeing the death of the general who spared his life back in North Korea, to try and kill Graves on the spot. <br clear=all>
